name: What is Angular and why should we be interested in AngularJS 2.0
description:
The talk will cover the background and history of where Angular came from, what Version1 delivered, and what is being delivered in Version2. It will also touch on the Google Developers Network, and discuss a little about the ‘founding team’ members from Google (and the open source community/contributors) including Brad Green - the current engineering director at Google responsible for the product

Agenda:

6.00 - 6.30   Networking, Beer and Pizza

6.30 - 6.40   What is a "Google Developers Group"

6.40 - 6.50  The GDG Hants & Surrey Organising Team

6.50 - 7.50   What is Angular and why should we be interested in AngularJS 2.0

Speaker: Bruce Pentreath

Bruce has over 40 years in the IT profession, specialising in application development, management and optimisation. With a deep practical background and experience in Agile and Waterfall methods; Bruce consults to Fortune 500 and Startups on future and current technology stacks; application frameworks and toolkits for application development platforms; for applications that run on a wide variety of OS and hardware platforms

7.50 - 8.30   More Networking, Beer and Pizza
how_to_find_us: Queen Mary's College is roughly a 20 minute walk from the station and there is ample parking on site for those coming by car

name: Google IO Extended Keynote - With Basingstoke Tech Scene  and GDG Reading & T V
description:
Come and join us for a Google IO Extended Keynote Party, we're all planning to meet up at Desklodge, watch the keynote and discuss some of the new and interesting changes that Google has coming over the next year

The keynote itself starts at 6pm and we'll have beer and pizza for everyone to enjoy. The keynote itself tends to be a lot of fun with the latest features being announced for Android, Google Play, Kubernetes, Google Cloud, Youtube and other services.

name: Kubernetes - Google's Container Engine Firebase Basics - Build Apps Fast
description:
We'll be taking a look front and backend flows across the course of these next 5 Meetups, starting with:

Kubernetes:
The orchestrator behind Google's Container Engine. In this talk, we'll discuss how you can leverage the amazing power of containers for enterprise resiliency on a shoestring

Firebase:
In this talk we'll present and overview of real-time database and storage including:

# Advantages and disadvantages of the real-time nature of Firebase database
# How NoSQL style compares to SQL databases
# Efficiency of data vs data duplication
# Authentication - email & password / Facebook / Google
# User management within the Firebase console - reset passwords, add/delete users
# How security is built in to the database
# Firebase storage - what it is and how to use it efficiently
# Functions - brief overview of what they do, to link to the next talk

name: Codeship - Using continuous integration Firebase Advanced - Focus On Your Users
description:
The next instalment in front and back end flows will look at:

Codeship - Automate everything
In this talk Lewis will discuss how Razorsecure is using Codeship's continuous integration system with Google's Cloud platform to revolutionise the way they develop software

Firebase Advanced - Focus on your users
In this talk Jules will build on the introduction Tom gave last time and explain how Apps in the Sky are using the advanced features of Firebase. These include:

Functions - customising Firebase to a specific application
Demo of Firebase functions - how you can trigger a push notification
Notifications - how they engage users and how to do them badly
Dealing with bad tokens - how functions can clean up as they go
Crash reporting - how it helps make apps more stable

name: Automated Testing - Using a robot army Front end design - It’s All In The UI
description:
The next instalment in front and back end flows will look at:

Automated Testing - Let a robot army test your software for you

In this talk Lewis will discuss automated testing tools such as robot framework, he will discuss how to create automated tests that will protect your codebase and make testing a joy!

It’s All In The User Interface - Front end design

In this talk Tom will discuss how look and feel counts towards how a user perceives your app. He will also cover the principles of UI design and the difference between UI and UX, how successful apps are built from the ground up with UX in mind and why good graphic design matters

name: Go Live! - Monitor & secure an environment How to make money from apps
description:
This event is co-promoted as a Venturefest Rumble Event. We are pleased to work in partnership Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council and Venturefest South, the showcase for innovators and entrepreneurs. This is part of a series run throughout the year to support emerging innovative businesses alongside local organisations IncuHive, Tech Juice, Desklodge and the SETsquared partnership

This month we welcome back Lewis Oaten from Razorsecure and Tom Colvin from Apps in the Sky for part four in our front/back end series where they will discuss their experiences and the tools that they have used in the respective businesses. So, come and join the us and be part of the growing tech community here in Basingstoke. All are welcome and we'll have free beer and pizza courtesy of our sponsors: Dominos, Desk Lodge and XL Communications. Here's what our speakers will cover this month:

Go Live! - Monitor & secure an environment

In this talk, Lewis will discuss monitoring a production environment using tools such as Rollbar, Stackdriver, Datadog and other leading SaaS products. He will also discuss some best practices in a production environment

How to make money from apps

In this talk, Tom will discuss reducing an app’s functionality down to a single purpose. Understanding what do you do better than anyone else and why it’s important to be great at one thing rather than mediocre at many. He will also cover these key areas for revenue generation:

* Multiple strategies - what are the ways you can earn money from an app?
* Using subscriptions - getting regular recurring revenue
* Single stream of revenue
* App store purchases

Sign up now it promises to be a great evening! We hope to see you there and look forward to welcoming you to our community - Adrian

name: Agile - Change your approach & deliver fast! Making Good Use of VR and AR
description:
We welcome back Lewis Oaten from Razorsecure and Tom Colvin from Apps in the Sky for part five in our front/back end series where they will discuss their experiences and the tools that they have used in the respective businesses. So, come and join the us and be part of the growing tech community here in Basingstoke. All are welcome and we'll have free beer and pizza courtesy of our sponsors: Dominos, Desk Lodge and XL Communications. Here's what our speakers will cover this month:

Agile - Change your approach & deliver fast!

In this talk, Lewis will discuss the principle of agile development, the upsides, downsides, warts and all. Also how Agile can revolutionise your software development approach and get your team delivering fast

Making Good Use of VR and AR

In this talk, Tom will discuss the key technologies and trends in VR/AR that App developers need to be aware of including:

* Google Cardboard
* Oculus
* Samsung Gear being given away
* Revenue numbers
* Pokémon Go

Sign up now it promises to be a great evening! We hope to see you there and look forward to welcoming you to our community - Adrian
